summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting a proffer interview with Efrain Reyes, who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) until August 9, 2019. The interview was conducted at the SDNY with AUSA Rebekah and other law enforcement present. The main body of the interview notes is heavily redacted/garbled, but the header establishes the interview's occurrence and context.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate in the SHU at MCC until August 9, 2019. Interviewed pursuant to a proffer agreement to provide information relating to the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Was incarcerated at MCC and shared a cell with Efrain Reyes.

persons.name: Rebekah
persons.context: Was in attendance for the proffer interview of Efrain Reyes at the SDNY.

connections.description: Were cellmates in Cell 220, L Tier, Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center until August 9, 2019.
Reyes was interviewed by AUSA Rebekah and other investigators as part of a proffer agreement.

events.title: Proffer Interview of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Efrain Reyes was interviewed at the SDNY under a proffer agreement to provide information related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The document notes Reyes was his cellmate until this date.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY), 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), Special Housing Unit (SHU), L Tier, Cell 220
keyFacts: Efrain Reyes was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate in the MCC's Special Housing Unit until August 9, 2019, the day Epstein died.
Reyes participated in a proffer interview with the SDNY on August 29, 2019, indicating he had information relevant to the investigation.
The substantive notes from Reyes's interview are heavily redacted or corrupted in the provided text, limiting the extractable details.
The document is an official FBI 302 record, indicating the information was formally collected by federal investigators.
